meanings.definition: Snarlier (comparative of snarly): tangled or twisted in a snarled manner
meanings.sent1: The snarlier vines made it difficult to walk through the forest.
meanings.sent2: Her hair became even snarlier after playing outside all day.
meanings.sent3: The snarlier shoelaces seemed to have a mind of their own, tying themselves in knots.
meanings.sent4: The snarlier traffic resembled a giant puzzle with cars tangled in every direction.
meanings.sent5: The snarlier branches of the tree looked like a chaotic web against the sky.

meanings.definition: Snarlier (comparative of snarly): showing aggression or hostility in speech or behavior
meanings.sent1: The dog became snarlier when someone approached its food bowl.
meanings.sent2: His snarlier tone indicated he was not in the mood to talk.
meanings.sent3: The snarlier cat hissed at anyone who dared to come close.
meanings.sent4: The snarlier customer made the cashier nervous with their rude comments.
meanings.sent5: Her snarlier expression warned others to keep their distance.
